hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades within a 10-day Bollinger Band width percentile < 20% (compression) while in NEUTRAL regime, a daily close above the 20-day SMA with volume > 1.5x 20-day average triggers a regime transition to BULL with 3-day momentum continuation.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. Low BB width indicates consolidation, while volume-backed break above SMA suggests institutional accumulation before trend resumption. Current neutral regime (61.5% confidence) with regulatory news flow creates setup potential.

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% gain from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence > 70%) for 3 consecutive days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% loss from entry OR daily close back below 20-day SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days without regime transition confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to hold > 48 hours with volume declining below average, or price reverses to recapture BB width expansion without regime shift.
